text: "I’m one of the first guys to introduce a climate change bill, way, way back in ‘87."
"I was always labeled as one of the most liberal members of the United States Congress."
"People show up in the emergency room with a sprained ankle, 25 percent get an opioid prescription."
The Trump budget "cuts $845 billion, almost a trillion dollar cut in Medicare."
"Since the passage of (the Violence Against Women Act), annual rates of domestic violence have dropped by 63 percent."
"There was virtually no new business investment" after the 2017 tax law. "The bulk was used to buy back their own stock."
Says military commanders have said that if Donald Trump were elected, "they would not follow his orders."
Says Donald Trump "is going to go out and carpet bomb" the Middle East.
"We have the most productive workers in the world."
"95 percent of the world’s customers are … beyond our shores."
"In the United States alone we lose more than 3,000 people a day to cancer."
Cervical cancer in Africa is "fully preventable with basic education, screening and vaccines."
"The vast majority of our international commitments take effect without congressional approval."
"There is a very identifiable Somali community" back home in Delaware.
The Obama administration's policies "have reduced minority dropout rate by 25 percent."
"I don't own a single stock or bond … I have no savings accounts."
"Since Newtown, more people have died at the end of a gun than we have lost in Afghanistan."
Paul Ryan "cut embassy security in his budget by $300 million below what we asked for."
"There's not one Democrat who endorses" the Romney-Ryan Medicare plan.
"We weren't told they wanted more security " for diplomatic facilities in Libya.
On ending the war in Iraq, "Gov. Romney said that was a tragic mistake, we should have left 30,000 troops there."
Says Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan would "eliminate the guarantee of Medicare."
"If Gov. Romney's plan goes into effect … the average senior would have to pay $460 a year more in tax for their Social Security."
"$500 billion of the extension of the Bush tax cuts for the wealthy goes to 120,000 families."
Says Republicans Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan support "massive cuts in Social Security for future generations."
Says in the last six months of the Bush administration, the U.S. lost 3.5 million jobs, including 760,000 jobs during January 2009 alone.
"When we took office, let me remind you, there was virtually no international pressure on Iran."
"The bulk of the people who are shot with a weapon — other than these drug gangs taking on one another — end up being shot with their own weapon."

The 30 percent tax rate called for under President Barack Obama’s proposed Buffett Rule "is lower than the prescribed tax rate for millionaires already -- not just for millionaires, for people making over $200,000."
"General Motors is the largest corporation in the world again."
"Nationwide tuition at public universities is up almost 300 percent ... in the last 20 years."
In Iraq, "violence is down to an all-time low" since the start of the war.
"The median income of a middle class family went down $2,100 from 2001 to 2007."
In Libya, "America spent $2 billion total and didn’t lose a single life."

"In 2008, when Flint had 265 sworn officers on their police force, there were 35 murders and 91 rapes in this city. In 2010, when Flint had only 144 police officers, the murder rate climbed to 65, and rapes … climbed to 229."
Says U.S. Rep. Paul Ryan’s budget proposal "eliminates Medicare" in 10 years.
"We have created more jobs in this last year than the Bush administration (did) in eight years."
"If you shut down Amtrak's Northeast Corridor, it's estimated you'd have to add seven new lanes to I-95 to accommodate the increased traffic."
"I never called for a partition" of Iraq.
"The health care numbers are going up."
"We're not engaged in nation-building" in Afghanistan.
"We went from losing 3 million jobs in the last six months of the Bush Administration," adding almost 600,000 private sector jobs in the first six months of the year.
"In the three months before the act took effect, America lost 750,000 jobs a month. In the last three months, we've lost about 35,000 jobs a month."
"There have been three people tried and convicted by the last administration in military courts. Two are walking the street right now."
Among the money spent on health care in the United States, "46 cents on every dollar spent is through Medicare and Medicaid."
"As long as I have served . . . This is the first time every single solitary decision has required 60 senators."
"Across the country, $174 billion of the Recovery Act have been committed in its first 130 days."
"When one person sneezes, it goes all the way through the aircraft."
"The average CEO makes $10,000 more every day ... than what the average worker makes every year."
"One percent of the American people make over 21 percent of all the income in America. That wasn’t the way before George Bush became president."
"John McCain voted against funding the troops because of . . . a timeline in it to draw down American troops."
"John McCain said...in December he was surprised there was a subprime mortgage problem."
Sen. McCain's tax plan provides "virtually nothing to the middle class."
John McCain said "he wouldn't even sit down with the government of Spain, a NATO ally that has troops in Afghanistan with us now."
"When George Bush said we shouldn't investigate why the government's response to Hurricane Katrina was so incompetent, John McCain stood with him."
John McCain's tax plan will give no reduction "for 100-million American families."
McCain supports tax breaks for companies that ship jobs overseas.
McCain voted 19 times against a minimum-wage increase.
Three years ago, John McCain said, "Afghanistan — we don't read about it anymore in papers because it succeeded."
"There's only four senators senior to me ... there's still 44 older than me."
(McCain) says "we can't have ... timelines to draw down our troops from Iraq."
On whether he wants to be vice president.
Says McCain "supported George Bush's policies 95 percent of the time."
Says McCain once said that on "the most important issues of our day, I've been totally in agreement and support of President Bush."
John McCain has changed position on invading Iraq.
"Barack Obama hasn't passed any (bills)."
"John doesn't have a record in the Senate. John's only passed four bills. They're all about post offices."
"There's not a major bill I know with Hillary's name on it."
Biden was responsible for "ending genocide in Bosnia."
"When Pakistan erupted in crisis, I spoke to Musharraf before Bush did."
Rudy Giuliani is "probably the most underqualified man since George Bush to seek the presidency."
"Here's a man who brags about how he made the city safe. It was the Biden crime bill that became the Clinton crime bill that allowed him to do that."
"In the 1990s, the Biden Crime Bill added 100,000 cops to America's streets. As a result, murder and violent crime rates went down eight years in a row."
"First, he said he would take all of our troops out in six months, and now he acknowledges it would take a year."
"First, he said he would leave residual forces in Iraq, and now he says he wouldn't."
"First, he was in favor of my plan, now he's attacking it."
"With one stroke of his pen, President Bush has denied health insurance to 3.8 million kids who were due to get it under this bipartisan expansion of the Children's Health Insurance Program."
"There are 300,000 babies born deformed every year in this country because of women who are alcoholics while they're carrying those children to term."
"Joe Biden is the only candidate with a plan to get us out of Iraq and keep us out."
"You know we can't just pull out now... The truth of the matter is: If we started today, it would take one year, one year to get 160,000 troops physically out of Iraq, logistically."
"The president is brain-dead."
"Roadside bombs are responsible for 70 percent of casualties in Iraq and these new mine-resistant vehicles can reduce those casualties by two-thirds."
